## Examples

```js
<Form layout="horizontal">
    <FormItem label="Name" extra={<p>Please enter your full name</p>}>
        <FormField name="fullName" />
    </FormItem>
    <FormItem label="Email" warnings={['Please double check your email']}>
        <FormField name="email" />
    </FormItem>
    <FormItem>
        <CheckboxWidget>Please spam me</CheckboxWidget>
    </FormItem>
    <FormItem fullWidth>
        <ButtonBar rightButtons={<Button>Save</Button>} />
    </FormItem>
</Form>
```

Should appear within a form:

```js
<Form>
    <FormItem label="Field label">
        <FormField />
    </FormItem>
</Form>
```

Layout is determined by parent form:

```js
<Form layout="horizontal">
    <FormItem label="Field label">
        <FormField />
    </FormItem>
</Form>
```

**Errors**

```js
<Form layout="horizontal">
    <FormItem label="Field label" errors="This field is required">
        <FormField />
    </FormItem>
    <FormItem label="Another field" errors={['This field is required', 'Must be at least 5 characters']}>
        <FormField />
    </FormItem>
</Form>
```

**Warnings**

```js
<Form layout="horizontal">
    <FormItem label="Field label" warnings="Please double check this is correct">
        <FormField />
    </FormItem>
    <FormItem label="Another field" warnings={['Please double check this is correct', 'Another warning']}>
        <FormField />
    </FormItem>
    <FormItem label="Errors and warnings" errors="This is required" warnings="Please double check this is correct">
        <FormField />
    </FormItem>
</Form>
```
